review: Sanadige is not a restaurant it’s a whole new dining experience, located in the diplomatic enclave the restaurant caters to mostly foreign delegates or people who are well versed with the cuisines offered by the restaurant. Me and my friend when we visited here were quite an exception, not very well versed about the cuisine but keen to try out new flavours. Our server Arun took special care keeping in mind our near about zero knowledge of the Mangalorian cuisine. The prawn ghee roast is easily the dish I’d like to have once again at least before I die simply for the outburst of flavours it got me to. The mutton sukka is another mild mutton preparation I’d recommend every non...read more
name: Sana-Di-Ge

review:
Feel alive is the ultimate place to be for good food and fine crowd. Located near my bar headquarters, this place is the one to be for jalapeno cheese rolls and sushi.

For dessert, the best was brownie sundae with icecream.
name: Feel Alive

review:
Was here with a couple of friends on sunday and tried their new menu that has 10-12 pan pizzas and loved the vegetarian one called farmers pick.
In the mocktails section don’t miss the newly launched malt brew!
name: Pizza Hut

review: So my brother had a client coming over, whom he wanted to take out for dinner at a fancy five star property to impress him a little so he chose this place out of recommendations of one of his friends and booked a table for three (he took me along for some reason best known to him). The ambiance is flamboyantly done and impresses at first sight nothing too fancy, the staff welcomes with a smile and guides you to a table of your choice. Starters were great starting from sushi’s to dimsums to galauti kebabs had live counters while some others were served to the table instead. The white sauce pasta had a creamy texture as it should but a distinct flavour as is to the other one I’ve...read more
name: Seventh Sense - Seven Seas Hotel

review:
Was here to meet a friend a long lost one who said dwarka had a great place to hangout at which I laughed at first but had to eat my words as soon as I entered this bomb of a place!
Amazing cocktails paired with great food and peppy music what else does one need to spend some time with buddy’s!
P.s. they have a separate deck area as well!
name: Barcode

review:
Went to kfc just before Navratri started to give myself a satisfaction!
Ordered a rice bowl wings strips hot and crispy chicken and a lot more since we were a group of 8 people!
Taste quality and everything else was great!
A thumbs up for the prompt service!
name: KFC

review:
Located near the famous Venky College in the street of Satya Niketan. So you will have to dig a little deeper to find this place and avoid the other food joints.

This place is a must visit for those who look for some really adventure themed or some themed restaurants.
name: Pirates Of South Campus

review:
On a friends recommendation we had ordered a prawn tempura sushi and some dimsums from this place a few weeks ago.
I just loved the packing and presentation of the food and taste itself was very good!
Would recommend both the dishes that I tried here!
name: Dimsum Vs Sushi - Chinese Kitchen

review:
Was here with a group of friends some time ago and tried their non vegetarian buffet and simply loved the food and hospitality by the staff.

The salad counter and dessert counter impressed me with the variety and taste!

The place is a must try!
name: Bon Barbecue

review:
During new year party preps at home we ordered some stuff from here as we were in mood to try out some chinese and oriental.

The food was timely delivered was surprisingly hot considering the weather conditions here in new delhi.

The dimsum platter and the khao suey(chicken) were both great and indeed stand in my recommendations list!

Great experience!
name: Happy Hakka

review: ECHOES as the name suggests means the voice of the unheard! Run by the wait staff of deaf and dump people connected through an NGO to help the noble cause with kitchen staff that does a great job coordinating with them! They have menu items with a depicted code with it to help them take orders in an hassle free manner. With a great stint in the satyaniketan market they came up to HUDSON LANE! The food and beverages have come a long way from the previous venture as almost everything on the menu is fabulous in taste. I didn’t find a single flaw in all the dishes served to us each with a wide smile on the server’s face. Some not to miss items in the menu would be Butter chicken-...read more
name: Echoes Hudson Lane

review:
Amazing food just loved the chicken Malai tikkka and the butter chicken must try!
I'm coming back for more!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Thee chatpati chaap and dal makhni are good too...
name: Tandoori Trumpets

review:
Visited this place with a bunch of friends on a lazy Sunday afternoon for lunch and they left me spellbound with the food and service!

The chicken biryani and the dimsums platter a 2 dishes you should just not miss here!
name: Soul Curry - Bellagio

review:
Simply the best daal makhni and Mutton roganjosh in delivery category in the area!

Had their tangri kebabs and Afghani chicken too they too were drool worthy!
name: Dilli BC

review:
Legendary of a place being run by the right hands is just how I'd put this cracker of a place in sarojini nagar market!

The seekh kebabs the mutton Curry the same Panna everything went great in our meal plus I was meeting an old friend after a long time so that adds a little to the experience!

The best tandoori chicken in a long time without a doubt, a place you can't afford to miss at all
name: Amar Jyoti

review:
Great food great hospitality and innovation that can leave you in spills my friend!
The parle g cheesecake is the only dish I had here since I was already full but trust me this review is not only about the one dish i had here but also about the warmth of the place!!!
name: Farzi Cafe

review:
The benefit of being born in West Delhi is I get a lot of food options over here.

Jail road has been a hub and consists of a lot of non veg delicacies. But then there is this shop serving good and only vegetarian food.

As I was with my veg friend we went in to try so good options, based on the owners option tried the malai chaap and masala chaap. Both of them were extremely amazing..

And not to forget the hygiene of this place a number plus because of that onlyz where are restaurants are giving sittings.in opening they have comfortable bright sitting inside.
name: Kukkad Nukkad

review: With absolutely no idea whatsoever about HIMALAYAN cuisine I enter this newly relaunched place in the hustle bustle lane oh Hauz Khas Village only to find out that there are places here that focus actually on food rather than just the vibe and artists making the place lively with an auto tune live performance! No knowledge of the cuisine, don't know how to use a pair of chopsticks I never thought it would be such a delightful experience. Aloo ka achaar was served first and what a delight it was to my palate, an outburst of flavours, God I never thought I'll be saying that for a vegetarian dish! Next came the pork steamed momos and Allu momos yes you heard it right aloo momossomething I...read more
name: Yeti - The Himalayan Kitchen

review:
This review is only based on the amazing ladoos I had from this place that my sister got from here a couple of weeks back!
Although I'm a big fan of bansal's ladoos but this place beats them to death indeed!

Can't wait to taste their food!
name: Nandi's

review:
A decent place to hangout with friends at the rooftop with hookah and delicious food, you simply shouldn't miss this one!

The drums of heaven and chilly garlic prawns are an out and out recommendations!
name: The Sky High

review:
A hero in disguise for a delivery kitchen that works midnight!

The trio sauce chicken pasta was a fantastic start to the meal!
The chicken khurchan with butter naan is yet another combination to die for!

They serve this boiled chana dish free with North Indian food that goes pretty well with your peg pugg at midnight.

For mains you should try Banjara kebabs!
name: Food Scouts

review:
Timely delivery, tasty food economical on your pocket what else do you need!

After having had their trio sauce pasta and butter chicken I ordered veg manchurian and chocolate brownies for dinner some time ago and my word they were awesome to say the least!

Do give them a try a fellas!!!
name: Food Scouts

review:
Not very often you come across a place that serves gourmet style food at odd hours in the city, this one surely is one of them!

The trio sauce pasta is truly the best pasta I've come across in a really long time a must try for all!

Their butter chicken too is equally good a dish to order from here!

To all those who're hungry at odd hours, this is your hero, period!

The best in the city deserves a try!
name: Food Scouts

review: Dilli bc is like that sight of relief for those looking for good mughlai and Indian cuisine food at affordable prices. They might be only a takeaway and dine out property but trust me they are probably serving the best indian I have tasted in Delhi-NCR. The highlights of the meal would undoubtedly be the Dal Makhni and the butter chicken the staples a true North Indian that too punjabi like me can't live without. The dal was creamy to the core with just the perfect blend of spices probably the best I have had in a really long time. The butter chicken wasn't sweet yet tangy and creamy in taste with property cooked pieces of soft marinated chicken, this just made my day with a perfect...read more
name: Dilli BC

review:
Had ordered from them the other day and the food was simply wow!
Murgh makhni and dal malhni with garlic naan are straight out recommendations!
name: London Street Kitchen

review: With the wake of us Indians becoming more and more interested in trying out continental and other foreign cuisines we have somehow forgotten the good old Punjabi food! Dhaba @ Atta brings you just right back to that cuisine! Having been here with a couple of friends couldn't try out much and them being non experimental had to go with the good old Dal Makhni and Butter Chicken Gujral ji wala both of which were extremely creamy and Punjabi in taste and every other aspect. The breads too were served hot and fresh coming out as perfect accompaniments. For desserts we had gulab jamun one dish without frill and fail I must say that steals my heart every time I have a bite. Overall a 5 on 5...read more
name: Dhaba At Atta

review: Satyaniketan has never failed to impress me with its charm when it comes to food experience and anything else except the parking problems in the area. A few days back we had a reunion sort of thing happening here and buoy what an experience, I'm amazed and why shouldn't I be? Effortlessly great service, amazing food and decent ambiance have made this place my next favourite without a doubt in the area. The KITKAT and STRAWBERRY shakes are a must try so is the BANANA AND ALMOND SMOOTHIE. Food too had great chicken dimsums and barbecue wings to die for, with the chocolate cake and tiramisu in the dessert section waiting for us to be left speechless with. Overall a MUST VISIT...read more
name: Pipeline Cafe

review:
QRO is one of the very first cafes in SATYANIKETAN market, after being recently revamped the place has left literally no stores untouched to be back with a bang.

They got the Satyaniketan market started with Khalil mehmoon sheesha and are still the only ones serving them at dirt cheap price in the market.

Food and drinks were great specially the Honey Almond shake and the Non veg platter!

The chilli chicken here is another must have and must not be missed!

Stay tuned for the detailed review!!!
name: QRO Gourmeteriia BY DARK HOUSE KAFE

review:
As they say you can't hide a SUPERHERO between the common man, this place does its job and is undoubtedly noticed by all for its charm and food.

With an X-BOX installed for the FUCCHAS to play and great cinematic posters doing the rounds all over the place you're bound to feel as if you're in BOLLYWOOD!

The food is great nothing that didn't go well but yes there are two things in the menu that really stole my heart and they are their MOMOS and the brownie and cookies shake!
I'd come back again for these really very soon.
name: Superstar Café

review: Kennedy's is like the local hero for Patel Nagar wallahs as amidst those narrow lanes there's hardly any good food joint for them to facilitate their hunger pangs with delicious street type snacks in both vegetarian and non vegetarian sections. Having heard from a lot of people about their food and as many as 11 dips served with snacks I was looking forward to them long time and then one fine day this place happened. The dips are simply WOW, I mean not only one but all of them were fabulous, special mention for the sweet chilli one. Coming to the food we tried a lot of dishes Dahi ke sholay- Dahi ke kebabs done innovatively by the chef himself with his very own recipe, highly...read more
name: Kennedy's

review:
You know the place has some serious issues to resolve when it is located between Al-Jawahar and Karim's and still sitting empty during the time of Ramzaan, but idiots like me will never back off to get their food earlier than the rest and enter such a place.

No a/c and zero ambiance while the competition has all major amenities.

Food I would say is just about average including the nahari, mutton keema in palak gravy and mutton korma.

Will I be back, no! My companion had a stomach infection the very next day.
name: Jawahar Hotel

review:
This was a part of our Jama masjid food walk concluded during ramzaan and I don't really think it was worth the wait.

Fried chicken and keema goli is all we had here and I hated both of them.

The keema goli which is a ramzaan special didn't have any keema in it and all I could taste was the chana daal.

The fried chicken was nothing fancy and how could it be with nothing different from the rest.

I really pity these places that are not doing justice to the history and legacy they should carry with their culianaire.
name: Haji Mohd. Hussain

review:
Decent and the only option here in Jama Masjid area for a buff biryani apart from Pahalwan ji.

I find this one better though it is on a difficult location to find but it is the taste that brings me back.

Chewed bones and pickle leftovers welcome you into a shabby looking shop but the biryani is great made in only buff for sale however they do veg, chicken and mutton on order.

The type is moradabadi achari biryani with a lot of spices that go into the garam masala but here used without crushing.

Recommended!
name: Dil Pasand Biryani Point

review:
The phrase "Since 1957" means a lot trust me, to the legacy of Nahari and of the Mughlai cuisine I put up my sincere efforts in this review to let the readers know how much does legacy mean keeping aside the ambiance and hygiene.

Located in the bylanes of Chitli qabar, matia mahal this place might be difficult to find but when you find it you won't regret.

The nahari here is made of buff and not mutton please avoid asking for mutton one prepared because their specialty doesn't lie there.

The nahari is perfectly cooked with wonderful flavours and aroma coming from it.

Served with khamiri roti this is just the perfect combination.

Highly recommended!
name: Haji Shabrati Nihari Wale

review: When you go out with friends for your birthday party, it becomes one of the most favourite place of yours not because you partied there on your day but because of the company, team molecule has made it furthermore better. Located in the Sector 29 market of Gurgaon or now Gurugram the place might look like just another one of those microbreweries but trust me it's a lot more than that. The food with the touch of molecular gastronomy and the cocktails here are just too good here, along with a wonderful waitstaff that not only makes you feel at home but also fulfills your each and every childish demand, I guess that's called pampering! The molecule brew beer which is their in house...read more
name: Molecule Air Bar

review: Luxurious yet low lit interiors are warm and welcoming to this bundle of joy called made in Punjab! I was here for a lunch with friends some time back and absolutely loved it! The banarsi peda lassi is a wonderful combination of peda and lassi that will make you forget any other fancy lassi. The nashili chai is another cocktail I was wooed by for it's simple yet kicking flavour, recommended straight from the belly 😜. For food we tasted a lot of dishes ranging from their famous mutton champ to the chicken tikkas and I must admit that there's nothing that really really went wrong. The maincourse had the luxurious butter chicken with a varq coating, not only the presentation but the...read more
name: Made In Punjab

review:
This place is basically for a quick grab n eat for snacks while you're on car-o-bar!

Located in the famous band Wala market this is the very dhaba on top floor of which the movie JOLLY LLB was shot.

We were here sometime back to grab a bite that included butter chicken, roti's and mutton seekh kebabs.

The food tasted decent but the quality was below average which is not justified with the pricing.

Recommended only when you're hungry and see no other major places open in the vincinity.
name: K.K. Family Restaurant

review:
Decent option for snacking at all times, fresh bakes and cakes is all what pilka has always been synonymous of to me at least in recent times.

I got myself a mushroom patty and a manchurian roll packed for breakfast/lunch, quite a junk right.

Even though the mushroom patty was fresh and crisp tasting very good the manchurian roll tasted decent with that little punjabi Chinese influence to it however I could taste no manchurian balls in it.

Overall a 3/5 experience for me.
name: Polka

review: With summers already round the corner, we all are searching for something sweet and cold that can beat the heat and leave a sweet aftertaste to remember. Shake square cafe is located near Kohat Enclave metro station, it was earlier named Keventers and only served shakes but has now changed the name to Shake square cafe, with a bit of revamp they now have a seating as well to serve some really good snacks with your favourite shakes. We were a group of three when we entered this place for some food and shakes. One kf my diet conscious friends ordered a chocolate protein shake and he said he liked it however I was against ordering such a thing at a small fast food kiosk. I ordered a...read more
name: Shakes Square Cafe

review:
Pappi macchi wala is a branch of a famous outlet in kirti nagar serving some lip smacking tandoori delicacies.

I've been here quite often for snacks with drinks when on a low budget enjoying drinks and great company.

The masala pyaaz they serve is fabulous, just the best chakhna you can ever get with your drinks.

The tandoori chicken and afghani chicken here are straight out recommendations for all.

Not to be missed is their chicken tikka and mutton seekh kebabs.

Recommended for simplicity and constant taste.
name: Pappi Machhi Wala

review: Located on the Punjabi bagh club road, the place is known for churning out wonderfully the not so widely accepted Lebanese cuisine in the city. The menu here is not much of a complicated thing, what it rather is a no bullshit simple menu that can impress everyone with its simplicity. I had ordered from them for a home delivery and the order reached me on time so full marks for the service. Coming to the food The grilled chicken was fantastic, perfect in every possible way and is recommended to all for complete balance of flavours. The jojo kebabs too were well made and delicious in every prospect and hence are recommended for all. Chicken doner was decent to taste and was amply...read more
name: Arabian Delites

review: Being a meat lover, and not having visited Karim's is a curse my friend trust me it is. With a history of over a 100 years there's no denying the fact that the eatery is arguably the most famous culinary destination in the city. Located on the Matia mahal road near the legendary Jama Masjid this place is the pride of the city, not only  for its culianaire expertise but also for the history and the royality attached with it. Like a fellow foodie quoted "Karim's is not just a restaurant like others in the vincinity, it is indeed a small neighbourhood." As you take a 5 step walk towards the place on the left side of the road you see not one not two as many as four sitting areas, in every...read more
name: Karim's

review: The place is pathetic, even though full of people trying to enjoy their evening but then if the staff is literally hitting the utensils to the floor you can't really enjoy much,Right? We were here on the last navratra as my brother wanted to have a great thali to end his fast and hadn't eaten much all day. Bikanerwala was our first choice but it was full and we learned it will take 45 minutes for our table to be ready. So he basically wanted a thali with raita to satisfy his hunger and craving both at the same time, so we went in with the super deluxe thali and a few non vrat dishes for the rest of us. We were supposed to be joined by family members in another half an hour so we asked...read more
name: Sagar Ratna

review: Sodabottleopenerwala, Daruwala, furniturewala and Tyrewala ahh! Enough of weirdish surnames well that's signature parsi for you. As interesting is the name of the place trust me almost every single thing on their menu has a little wow factor attached to it that will be the signature SodaBottleOpenerWala touch for you. Located in DLF mall of India in sector-18 of noida, the place attracts quite a lot of attention from fodies in the vincinity for it's out of the box name and the well deserved goodwill and fame earned by the from their previously opened and successful outlets in Cyberhub, Gurugram and Khan Market. The ambiance of the place is that of a typical parsi cafe with chalk and...read more
name: SodaBottleOpenerWala

review: I was here with a buddy of mine for some work that was to take some time, so we thought of grabbing a quick bite before anything else. Diamond cafe is located on the main market road itself, we ordered a portion of chilly chicken and two cold drinks. It took them around 20 odd minutes to bring in the order which I'd consider to be slow by the standards of the market they are serving in. With all foreign clientele they are mostly full of people who will sit for a while and enjoy their food with time, but to us it looked a little too long. The chilly chicken was not too good to taste, neither did it impress me with the quality and quantity. It looked undercooked, tasted raw and...read more
name: Diamond Restaurant

review: Ardor is like that place in CP which is doing pretty well sitting dear in the heart of the city that too without much promotional activities, you know why? Because of the lipsmacking food and wonderful service they offer. I was here for a party among some friends on a lazy Sunday afternoon, it truly couldn't get better at all! With some great sheesha, drinks churned out well by the talented bartender Shankar and amazing food this place has made my experience not only memorable to me but envious to those who didn't turn up. Starting with the drinks Shirley Temple and Watermelon Mojito will be my picks in the non alcoholic part and in the alcoholic part the best drinks were the Old...read more
name: Ardor 2.1

review:
I don't know what's wrong with these legendary places that have either let their quality down and the taste as well put at stake but what they have also done is let their true patrons down.

First of all they are crowded as hell, the jalebi here is too thick and overly sweet as well. I mean honestly I wouldn't taste such a piece of jalebi if I hadn't travelled that far for this.

Completely passable!
name: Old Famous Jalebi Wala

review:
I was here for a quick bite last night, located on the jail road itself right next to TUMMY SECTION operated by Chef Ripudaman Handa the place is sure to have a lot of competition.

I ordered a mutton seekh roll with egg that cost me ₹100/-.

Decent to taste, amply filled and well packaged what else could one ask for?

Recommended!
name: 34, Chowringhee Lane

review: Heritage and food are one combination that can put the rest to rest without much talk, because someone who loves food will always want to taste the delicacies related to the Heritage and History of the place he is eating out at. Lakhori- Haveli Dharampura was not only a place where I wanted to go for the food and buzz created by my friends it was something I wanted to see with my own pair of eyes because the thought of a Haveli in such narrow lanes of Chandnichowk gave me thrills. The property from the inside is grand and glamorous with an evident touch of Heritage in every bit, from the outside you can't really see it properly courtesy the narrow lanes. The decor here is something I...read more
name: Lakhori - Haveli Dharampura

review:
i visited this place last night, to satisfy some immediate hunger pangs before the much awaited food walk to Matia mahal, jama masjid.

to my surprise my fav place to have some steamed momos in vikas puri was already closed, so this guy comes upto me and asks me to come up to his stall which is hardly a couple of metres away.

to my surprise this place has been around for 10 odd months, and is a pure vegetarian outlet.

Wasting no time I ordered my portion of veg momos (steamed) that cost me RS40/- only for a portion of 5 pieces, taste and quality were pretty decent keeping in mind the pricing.

 the place is worth a shot to say the least and I'm soon gonna try them out again.
name: Loaf Magic

review:
Pro's
ECONOMICALLY PRICED
TASTE
QUANTITY
Con's
HYGIENE
SERVICE
QUALITY

Just imagine ₹40/- for a raita topped with a lot of pomegranate and dry fruits, no seriously I'm not kidding.

Dal Makhni and Palak paneer will be the other recommendations.

Completely passable place, HYGIENE not maintained at all!
name: Inderpuri Restaurant

review: Oops the meter probably broke, going beyond 5/5 maybe, while there are million eateries in Jama Masjid to eat out at, this one is beyond compare! Seekh kebabs are one such dish that everyone expects to be soft and melt in mouth kind of texture, this place will give you just that my friend. Any other place in the capital will not make your kebab right in front of you, instead they'll just reheat it and serve. They make fresh kebabs, top them with nutralite butter and serve with chutney, pyaaz and rumali roti. The taste is divine and an experience worth the crave, must visit if you're around jama masjid. Price ₹60/- for 3 pieces of bada kebabs (buff) ₹90/- for 3 pieces of...read more
name: Qureshi Kabab Corner

review:
Claiming to be a part of the much famous kachori wala by the same name in azad market and kamla nagar, I'm not too convinced with the claim though.

Shahi kachauri wale is a completely different class to me, almost everything on their menu is far beyond comparison to any other place.

The kachauri sabji here is average, not recommended at all.
name: Shahi Kachauri Wale

review: Tamasha is the latest addition to Mr Priyank Sukhija's collection of jewel like restaurants that not only impress you with food but also leave an ever lasting impression by the decor and other small detailings that make you fall in love with the place. He likes to treat his places like his girlfriends and yes he's the most enviable restaurateur and boyfriend in town with such upmarket places under his belt. Coming to this place, it's huge like most of his properties but yes it's the food that has made fall in love with the place. The chicken chettinad or however it is spelled was a perfect balance of flavours with the right amount of spices and was well complimented with the malabar...read more
name: Tamasha

review:
This place is a dhaba located on the najafgarh road surrounded by band walahs in tagore garden and not Rajouri Garden as mentioned by Zomato.

Serving both veg and non veg, I happened to visit them some time ago (hours) and had their keema kaleji and butter chicken delivered in my car as it was too late for them to service in car.

The staff is arrogant and ignorant of sorts but the food is pretty decent.

Keema kaleji will be my recommendation!
name: KK Da Dhaba

review: Someone once asked me why do they have McDonalds, pizza hut and other such QSR's in a market like Cyberhub? I feel I have an answer to that now, it is for the employees of bpo's and call centres that these outlets are running in such an elite market. A friend of mine met me here, a college friend who had left college midway wanted to meet me and his bpo co workers at the same time so I agreed as I was in the sector 29 market anyways. I ordered my regular chicken maharaja mac with a serving of coke, pretty satisfied with the taste and quality, the service too was quick and made to the table as we were a bunch of 10 I do recommend them for a quick bite, the only issue I remember was...read more
name: McDonald's

review: After having stared at their rainbow pastry for almost 8 months whenever I craved for something sweet I visited this place after meeting my friend at Italiano a few months back. Already full and stuffed to the top while I chose to order a rainbow cake slice my friend chose to just stare at it and think really bad of my appetite. The presentation of the cake is fantastic, you can number the colour layers from a distance without a problem, boy it looked fantastic and tasted decent too. A bit too pricey but I'll buy that for the presentation alone and it did taste well too. Hope to see them soon at a nearby outlet as gurgaon can be quite a fight and I'm not going there without someone...read more
name: Angels in my Kitchen

review:
You can call me crazy but yes this is true, I visited Farzi cafe and tried just one thing, The Parle G cheesecake.

Trying to kill time and knowing I couldn't really take my friend here for dinner I decided to give this a try on my own.

The parle g cheesecake is presented in an amazing manner topped with gems in a base of rabri it is what I suppose, but the taste I wouldn't say it was amazing but it wasn't disappointing either.

Will soon be back to try out the whole menu maybe at the CP outlet.
name: Farzi Cafe

review: Legendary places don't need much of an introduction, do they? Wenger's Deli is located in the inner circle of cp right next to shake square, serving some really delectable stuff from their transparent and neat looking kitchen. Finding a table could be a fight in here trust me any day of the week, we were lucky enough to find one within minutes of reaching here. The order taker helped us a lot in ordering the stuff for three of us:- We chose Nutella waffles Banana and toffee waffles Chicken club sandwich Chocolate moose Waffles here are probably the best in the city, period. The second best I've ever had after chaar dukaan in mussorrie, I highly recommend the nutella ones! The...read more
name: Wenger's Deli

review:
I agree it is located in the best property in the city but the truth is if Mr. Amitabh Bachhan couldn't save his son's career cause he wasn't made for the film industry, this place can't really be saved by the legacy and charm of the leela palace.

Was here for a workshop on cooking and baking, we were served a pretty elaborate buffet spread probably being the only positive I carried from the brunch.

There was nothing worth remembering, the ratings they get are only for the perfect cremè bruleè and the decent hospitality.

Completely avoidable!
name: Le Cirque - The Leela Palace

review: China garden is like this legendary place in CP, serving authentic Chinese cuisine without compromising on the quality and authenticity given the rigid Indian clientele who prefer punjabi influence to their Chinese food experiences. The staff I must say is one major reason we had a gala time here, I thanks them from the bottom of my heart for the wonderful service and unbeatable courtesy. We chose the buffet spread that had a set menu but unlimited quantities. Starting with Smoked chili prawns, these were served with red chilies, tasted decent enough but the chilies served along looked totally waste as couldn't dare to taste them. The gin chicken was basically a chicken ball topped...read more
name: China Garden

review: Life caffe is like this little hidden gem in B block of cp, inner circle right next to ccd in hotel citrus, they cater to hotel guests and walk ins as well. With both indoor and outdoor seating capacity available we chose, indoor seating courtesy, Sun and a lot of heat. Casually decorated and set up with a little light colours the place impressed me with its effortless charm, nice playlist as well. The servers did a just about average job, not too courteous, not well informed but very much obeying. The food spread was decent, right from the veg spring rolls and chilli mushrooms to some really good chicken wings in BBQ sauce, recommended! For the drinks I'd recommend Humming bird and...read more
name: Life Caffe

review: Mystique Mélange is a wonderful place to dine out with friends and family, actually you can also rely upon them for your corporate meetings and other such arrangements. Located in Ahok Vihar, opposite to DEEP market the place is divided in three sections Restaurant, Lounge and Terrace. We were here for a get together with family and friends, at the restaurant that serves authentic Indian and Mughlai cuisine, and there was honestly nothing that disappointed us. Being the sibling of Sufiaana by Cherish banquets the food and drinks menu have pretty much in common barring a few tweeks and specialities. The Murgh cheese tikka here is a must for its perfect marination and out of the world...read more
name: Mystique Melange

review: Honestly I'm someone who has no idea of how to use chopsticks, so visiting Dao to taste Thai cuisine was not only a dining experience but it was rather more of a adventurous trip of some kind. The place is located in Gk-1 M block market amidst another 50 odd eateries, designed in a casual manner with low lit dining area and a centrally placed bar. The waitstaff here is excellently mannered and well versed with the menu that came out as a surprise to me as I kind of struggled reading the menu to myself. Talking about the drinks, we were served with a mojito with cucumber and mint leaves, that tasted a bit off beat to me, I mean a good to taste drink but not as good as your regular...read more
name: Dao

review: Late night hunger pangs are something you just can't resist, enter the Saviour I FOOD YOU! Too lazy to go out and search for that paranthe wala to felicitate your hunger, here is the magic number. With a no bullshit simple menu, the place will surely keep you satisfied with their offerings. We ordered a Lucknowi Chicken biryani that came with an authentic mirchi ka saalan and raita and were fairly satisfied with the quantity and the pricing, the taste too was very good, ignoring the fact that it was not authentically Lucknowi it was a 4.5/5 to me. The veggie burger kind of disappointed me for the fact that the peas used in the patty were somehow raw and couldn't really go well with...read more
name: I Food You

review: Unplugged Courtyard is one such place in CP that impresses you with its charm with the very first sight, why? Because of the setting of the place, I mean where else in Delhi would you find three different types of seating- indoor seating with all modern amenities, outdoor seating by the banyan tree with swing like chairs with a chopaal type of setting and not to forget the rooftop seating. The food part is one such section I had heard UC is excellent at and they justified every claim made by my fellow foodies who recommended this place to me. The LIIT was wonderful drink to start with, the five spirit drink is anyways the best kick to but for a happy high experience. The nutty jack was...read more
name: Unplugged Courtyard

review: There are a few places in the Delhi food scene where you visit for the food, the drinks or maybe the ambiance or the hospitality, but I'd proudly say there is this one place in the city I'm proud of having dined at, and it by no means is a fancy looking five star property where you'd shed out around 10k or something for two, this place shares the joy of togetherness and equality. ECHOES is this place down the south campus in Satyaniketan market which has just opened a month and a half back, yes this place has Deaf and Dumb people as their waitstaff and they are proud of it. Living among a society of commoners who barely talk to their families and neighbors, there is this bunch of young...read more
name: Echoes Satyaniketan

review: Odeon social is the talk of the town, this need not be told to anyone who is about to read this review. Located obviously next to the famous odeon cinema the place is already a landmark, the nearby paan Wala quoted "Bhaiya abb toh hum bhi social ki vajah se raat ke 2:30 baje takk paan lagate hain". As you reach the place, and enter this thing of beauty, you feel like you're back to school with a school reception style centred table booking area, school type vintage interiors like, old telephones, those wired chairs, fans and even swings on the balcony. Then you see rooms being labeled as Chemistry lab, staff room and stuff, boy the feel of nostalgia hits you right at the very...read more
name: Odeon Social

review:
Cafe red garden kitchen is like a pleasantly set up place in supermart 2 market in gurgaon, nearest to Huda city centre metro station.

The place is a garden with tables set around with decent table cloths and cutlery, they do have a mocktails bar and an indoor seating too.


They have a huge wood fired oven for pizza along with a pasta station that's bound to put your italian cravings to rest.

The food here is simply great with decent portions and amazing quality, not only does it appeal to the eye but it also appeals to the belly.

Recommendations would be:-

Oreo Shake
Watermelon and Grilled Chicken Salad
BBQ Chicken Burger
Choco Lava Cake.

Highly recommended!
name: Cafe Soul Garden

review:
Keventers is like the mecca for shakes in the city in fact in the country, favourite place to enjoy milkshakes for people of all age groups .

My favourite has always been their butterscotch flavour and the chocolate flavour. The prices are economic for the normal flavours around ₹150/- and for the innovative flavours like choco mint vit is ₹200/-.

I would recommend both butterscotch and mango flavours.
name: Keventers - The Original Milkshake

review:
Casa Asia is a night delivery chain that operates from 6pm to 4am in Malviya Nagar and nearby areas.

Their food is pretty decent considering it to be from a place that delivers at odd hours.

Their chicken devil dumplings are just out of the world and are one of the most recommended dishes here!

The thai red curry too tasted delectable.

For desserts we had both chocolate truffle and red velvet both of which were fine to taste and hence are recommended.
name: Casa Asia

review:
Located on the hush n hush lane of punjabi bagh club road, this place mostly caters to those who carry their drinks in car with kukkad and boti from any place around suits them well.

I visited their seating area as I went to us the washroom and found it extremely unhygienic and hence wouldn't recommend dine in.

The food however is great,

We had chicken biryani that tasted great if to be spoken of a pulav, not exactly a biryani.

Their chicken reshmi kebabs are to die for and are highly recommended for their softness and mildly flavoured Mughlai taste.

I'd be back for the reshmi kebabs.
name: Mughal Darbar

review: The great kebab factory is often regarded as the mecca for kebabs in Delhi- NCR. To me it was not the case, with a top notch 5 star property located in Mahipalpur, you are bound to expect more because of the airport crowds visiting them more often. The buffet spread menu is great with focus on both veg and non veg dishes. What I would recommend from their menu is listed below:- Veg galauti is decent to taste, with perfectly balanced flavours and the softness inherited from mushrooms. Karare aloo were another vegetarian delicacy that one should not miss. The singhade ka kebab is the thing to try out here with full piece of singhada or panifal marinated with tandoori spices is roasted...read more
name: The Great Kabab Factory - Radisson Blu Plaza Delhi Airport

review:
Invitation has been like the place I've been visiting since childhood, and my love for their food has always gone further.

Not too fancy a place with interiors, but their food really compensates for everything else.

Dal makhni, paneer butter masala and malai kofta have been my favourites here since childhood when I was a vegetarian, but as I converted to a carnivore diet their butter chicken has become my favourite.

I would in fact rate it above moti mahal, daryaganj, for its balanced flavours and not so sweet yet creamy taste.

Highly recommended!
name: Invitation

review: So there are basically two cafeterias by the same name serving as the canteen to the nearby pentament hospital and a good snacking option for fakeeers like us who really want to have almost everything at the cheapest price. Jokes apart the place is much like rahul eggs in lawrence road serving over a 100 varieties of maggi and pasta. With almost 50 varieties to the sandwich and burger section the menu is no less than a detailed FBI investigation. Most of the varities in a particular section taste almost the same but what matters is that they taste really good. I'd really recommend their coffe bar section and the double masala maggi. Not to be missed is the sandwich section the paneer...read more
name: Penta Cafeteria

review: Qubitos the terrace cafè is like the place that has its own vibe that connects with almost every guest that walks in their door. Spread over the top floor of west side story restaurant building they have an extended top floor terrace as well which is well done with seating and other important amenities. They serve great sheesha and drinks, their mocktails are really great. The food too is decent but needs a lot of improvement, both in taste and quantity. Butter chicken spring rolls are highly recommended. Edit-18/04/2016 I had visited Qubitos again in order to see if what my friends said was correct or not, and boy what a turnaround it was, Honestly I've never seen such an...read more
name: Qubitos - The Terrace Cafe

review:
I visited this place for a quick little meeting with an old friend, during winters and hence we chose to sit on the rooftop to get the proper chilling feel.


We ordered
A chicken penne pasta in red sauce
A sheesha
And a few drinks to go along with it.

The pasta was well made with decent chicken pieces and was spiced to perfection as well,recommended.

The sheesha too was well made but the chilling winds kind of made it a struggle for us.

The service was slightly off and it does need a bit of improvement.
name: Boombox Cafe Reloaded

review:
Bawa chicken is located in ramesh nagar in the market opposite fun cinema.

I've been here like 3-4 times during the winter season all thanks to one of my cousins who introduced this place to me for their wonderful chicken soup.


Well we've always dined in our car but I huess they have a seating space as well for about 20 people.

The kalmi kebabs, chicken afghani and the soup are best bets over here.

For main course I would recommend you the chicken biryani which is more of a pulao but still is a delectable option with the gravy to satisfy your hunger.
name: Bawa Chicken

review:
Nice little Dhaba near milan cinema in karampura area (moti nagar) is known for its lip smacking mutton curry and brain curry.

With hardly any amenities the dhaba serves you crisp tandoori roti's along with your favourite gravy item.

I tried their chicken and mutton curry as well as the super savoury brain curry that not only has become my favourite but has been my driving force to visit this place at least 3-4 times a month.

Highly recommended!
name: Bahadur Restaurant

review: Someone had recommended woodbox cafè long back for their chicken ceaser salad and thr Mother of Chicken burger, so I decided to give them a try. With a seating of hardly 20 people the cafe is well done with wooden casual interiors and a feedback wall thing that is very common with the south campus cafes. Wasting no time and taking suggestions seriously we ordered a chicken ceaser salad and a Mother of Chicken burger along with an oreo milkshake. The food arrived in quick succession and I must say that the salad was one of the most creamiest one I've ever had and I recommend it to each and everyone. The mother of chicken burger tasted decent to say the least but it looked perfect...read more
name: Wood Box Cafe

review: So when Mayank Arya visits a new outlet minus me and likes it, he makes a point that I try it out real soon by hook or by crook. Hook would be talking about the place for a week or so in order to allow me some time create a crazy craving in my mind for stuff I haven't tasted or crook would be dragging me literally to a pure vegetarian outlet to try it out. This one was a crook, and I'm glad it happened. Located in the beginning of Gujranwala Town the place is surrounded by dhabas and other street vendors and is winning the market by a clear margin. Talking about the food Their besan ka cheela is fabulous to say the least, served with two types of chutneys I loved it. The malai...read more
name: Nut Khut Caterers

review:
Ashok meat wala and Ashok and Ashok meat Dhaba both at first are two different entities while Ashok meat wala serves pure desi ghee korma with minced meat, Ashok meat Dhaba on the other hand offers chicken and mutton in pure desi ghee as gravy.

Talking about the food here at the Gujranwala town outlet, one plus point is that they are open for both lunch and dinner service while the meera bagh outlet is open only for lunch service.

Their korma tastes fantastic with the sweet taste and the aroma of desi ghee, it kind of recreates that amalgamation to my mind while writing this review.

Small tandoori roti's that cost ₹5/- provide good company to the gravy.

Highly recommended!
name: Ashok Meat Wala

review: When nostalgia struck us three of lovely omelette that we had a week back in Mussoorie, we started looking for a substitute. After having heard from many people about this place and it's spellbound variety of 350+ types of omelettes we zeroed in on this one. Reaching the place is easy it is nearby Kanhaiya nagar metro station, the outlet is small and hence we decided to order from our car itself. The menu is confusing actually confusing is just an understatement, the staff itself isn't aware about most of the menu apart from the top 5-10 names. They would recommend you themselves looking into the menu which is quite a shame. Coming to the food, we tried 4-5 varieties of omelettes...read more
name: Rahul Eggs

review:
Subway is like that breathe of fresh air for those who are forced to grab a meal outside in order to save time and effort.

We were three friends here in the Satyaniketan market, so we decided to visit 3-4 places to satisfy our hunger and make the most of the variety on offer in this market full of eateries.

What I'd recommend here is Chicken teriyaki sub or salad along with coke and a double chocolate chip cookie for sweet ending to the meal.

3/5 for the outlet's standard taste and average service.
name: Subway

review:
I fail to figure out what the fuss is all about this place?
Whenever I used to pass by jail road I'd see huge crowds waiting for their bowl of chicken soup, people would swear by his soup calling it the next big thing in west Delhi.

As I gather the courage to wait for my bowl of soup and reach the place, this is what I found out.

Boiled chicken and eggs in a thick broth gravy served with a topping of butter and cream.

To me this is nowhere close to the best soup in town in fact I wouldn't even give it another try.

Not recommended at all!
name: Sunny Chicken & Chicken Soup

review: A legendary place that has been around for decades serving the people of Delhi one of the best chicken curry in the city. So we a group of three went to this place at around 7 searching for some good food to accompany with our talks. We ordered a quarter portion of CHICKEN CURRY and chicken seekh kebabs accompanied by roomali roti's and soft drinks. The chicken curry I must say was one of the best curries I've ever had but the chicken pieces inside kind of disappointed me for them being visibly undercooked let aside the taste. The chicken seekh was decent and the chutney and ring onions provided good company to the seekh kebabs. Will I be visiting again? Maybe, all this for ₹544/-...read more
name: Kake Da Hotel

review: Daryaganj to me has never meant to be a vegetarian spot for dining out, it has always meant the changezi chicken and zaika's that were in my conception. In company of my vegetarian buddies on a Tuesday we reached here late night, looking for something good to eat and an instant reply from a friend took us to sugandh. We ordered Dal Makhni- Extremely creamy Indian staple cooked to perfection probably on my top five list in delhi, highly recommended. Pudina Paneer- Crumbled cottage cheese in a slightly creamy and pudina gravy this dish undoubtedly stood out and I might just come back for this one. Dum Aloo- A tangy gravy with small aloo stuffed with paneer, this is something I don't...read more
name: Sugandh

review: I don't really know what kinbuck 2 means and have slightly lost the curiosity to find out. The name says Kinbuck 2 a roman bistro, but what is so Roman about the place I fail to figure out. Maybe the brick wall interior and those lights what they may call roman, sorry I'm not amused. What does f^*k in hindi have to do with a roman bistro's decor? Their bar is tucked on the corner which is another thing I don't like because I'd only go to the bar myself and take that stool if it's located in the middle and not search for a hideout kind of thing in the corners. The service I would say is very well managed and the servers are helpful with the menu and ordering, probably the rating is only...read more
name: Kinbuck 2

review: IMLY- Innovative Magnificent Lavish and Yankee. For years I have been searching for a place to eat with my family on vegetarians who don't like to eat at places that serve non vegetarian food at all. What I have found? Well honestly nothing other than a few take away dhaba style joints and the ever falling Sagar ratna for south indian food. Sick of all this we finally have a place with that wow factor that not only gets the vegetarians happy but also pleases non vegetarians with their innovative yet tasty food. On a Sunday evening we three decided to dig into some delectable chaat and headed straight to rajender place where this 250 ft long beauty of a place is set up. The waiting...read more
name: Imly

review: Taxi is probably the only place in GTB nagar (to the best of my knowledge) that serves booze, we by the way landed here just like that after we saw about half an hour waiting at the outlets that we wanted to visit. We ordered a non veg platter, white sauce pasta and also their chicken fried rice. The platter and the dip were nice and loved by all and hence come out as a straight out recommendation. The pasta was nicely boiled but lacked the consistency of flavours maybe because of the sauce being inconsistent. The chicken fried rice were the saddest part of the evening with a mix veg pulao tossed with dry chicken cubes served to us that tasted really bad and unexplainable. The...read more
name: Taxi Bar & Cafe

review: Sandy Gurneet Kaur I was invited for the launch of this sports bar and bowling alley in Essex farms located on Aurobindo marg. The place has been completely revamped and created with the idea of a casual yet party type hangout with friends. Half the area is dedicated to games and bowling, while the rest is covered by bar and dining area. The place is grand and could be a great spot for a party, they do have a smoking room as well. Coming to the food and beverage section, I would recommend their white sauce pasta, the pepperoni pizza and the ravioli in the food section while their 3 versions of LIIT are highly recommended as well. The service too is decent and unhassled keeping in...read more
name: Yes Minister - Pub & Kitchen

review: The burger club they say is a kiwi (new zealand) chain of burger restaurants but I have no proof to justify it. So this review dates back to the raksha bandhan days and hence I take no responsibility of how this tastes today. My dear sister Akansha Kalra got these wonderful burgers packed for us and boy she picked the right outlet for this. We had the island veg burger if I can correctly recollect that had a veggie patty and a similar size slice of caramelised pineapple that made the burger taste divine. The kimara fries are a new introduction to the Indian foodie scene but I do welcome it, a must try. A 4.5/5 from my side for a vegetarian meal at outlet that serves non veg, boy...read more
name: The Burger Club

review:
This is a small roadside kiosk on paschim puri side of the club road.

Famous for it main course dishes that don't amuse me much the place had been on my list for long now and hence we gave it a try.

We ordered mutton curry, chicken karahi and a couple more oil dripping Punjabi curries to satisfy our hunger.

The portion sizes to me looked small considering the price point, however the taste is pathetic there was nothing really that we could finish and hence we offered it to hungry kids outside.

I guess that's the only good thing that happened that day but the taste was bad it could fill your stomach but not satisfy your hunger and appetite.

Not recommended at all.
name: Khalsa

review:
Five star Dhaba is like a blessing for those who work nearby and also foodies like me.

So this place is like a QSR in itself as they have food packed in fixed portions and kept in warmer and they serve it to you within seconds along with your preferred breads and complimentary salad.

What I'd recommend you to try is almost everything on their menu but my personal favourites are listed below:-
Keema kaleji
Dhaba meat
Lemon chicken
And kheer for desserts.

The place is truly a five star as you might spot white collar people and mla mp's enjoying their meal on the table next to you.
name: Five Star Dhaba

review: Junkyard cafe simply put is the new talk in the capital and the buzz about the place is here's to stay! Conveniently located in N block of CP the place is located amongst the ever busy BBQ NATION and Town house Cafe. Reaching the place only if you search the place by N block as their location is not pin point on GPS. As you enter the place you see a lot of fancy junk right from tire piles to rugged tables and other amazing interiors. As per my knowledge their music system can put clubs to shame. The staff is courteous and helpful and the food too arrives on time with a smile on the server's face. FOOD Their Prawn Tempura sushi is undoubtedly the best I've had and is wonderfully...read more
name: The Junkyard Cafe

review: Spize is this buffet themed restaurant with charcoal grill on the table to serve you starters and then the maincourse and desserts being served at buffet counters. The place is a bit far away from the nearest metro station so you might need a cab. Talking about the food, we were served a plethora of dishes that I atleast can't count on my fingers. Their chilly prawn starter and grilled fish were clearly the highlight of the day however the chicken tikka and mutton seekh kebabs too tasted delectable. The main course section of the buffet serving restaurant has always been considered average, however this place too stands in almost the same category however I liked their dal and...read more
name: Spize Barbeque & Bar

review: After having passed through this restaurant on mangal bazaar road for the last one year seeing long queue of people eagerly waiting for their portions I decided to give this one a try. So I got myself 1/2 chatpati chaap roll and 1/2 malai chaap roll packed. The portions considering the price are decent and the packaging too was done pretty well. Mint chutney and onions were provided in abundant quantity despite the sudden rise in price of onions. The chaap too tasted decent but nothing over the top. The rumali roti was rolled in such a manner that made the filling invisible from both ends that somehow turned me off. Recommend their chaap tikka instead avoid rolls. I'm coming back...read more
name: Khalsa Veg Corner

review: Lord of the drinks is one good name for a place that stands out in almost every aspect possible for a restaurant that is themed on dim lit ambiance and amazing cocktails with quirky distinct flavours. Cocktails are their USP no doubt but what amazes me is the equally delectable food from various cuisines that turns out to be just the perfect companion for the drinks. Located opposite monkey bar on the outer circle of connaught place, the place is grand and spread across two floors, the staff is welcoming and helpful. The interiors have been done keeping in mind the USP to set a party mood for people looking to get over their problems and have a blast. DRINKS POWER STROKE LIIT- With...read more
name: Lord Of The Drinks

review:
Natural's ice cream is like the best thing that can happen to natural flavoured frozen desserts.

Having captured a huge share in the frozen desserts scene in delhi with their cp outlet they have opened doors in rajouri garden as well.

The outlet is grand by the standards of an ice cream parlour in west delhi.

Flavours that I would suggest are
Litchi, jack fruit, tender coconut and mango.

Their weekly specials are good too.

A scoop at ₹60/- with taxes somehow defines perfect end to any meal.
name: Naturals Ice Cream

review: Oberoi Biryani is located bang opposite BSES office in rajinder nagar, it was recommended to me by many people including Mayank Arya who final took me there. There's not much to talk about the ambiance and please avoid peeping through the door of their washing area otherwise you might just not be able to gather enough courage to complete your meal let alone enjoying it. Coming to the food I have had their chicken korma that tasted really nice with the rotis mostly being people's last resort when they're out of stock for biryani. Okay so the biryani is not exactly biryani it rather is a chicken pulav topped with gravy with too much in abundance of pudina. Same is the case with mutton...read more
name: Oberoi Biryani

review: Hauz Khas Social is like the place you have to visit once you're in Haus Khas village. Just like one can't imagine jama masjid without KARIM's you can't just think of HKV without Hauz Khas Social. Probably the most reviewed place on zomato, social is located just in the beginning of hauz Khas village line, the eatery is spread across a huge area, so as you enter and see the dim lighting and peppy music you get into the party groove. So I had heard a lot about the place but never had the chance to be here, but one fine afternoon I saw someone's photo of fererro rocher shake that made me drool and we landed up here knowing the fact that it is a Tuesday and it would be empty. But...read more
name: Hauz Khas Social

review: When it comes to mughlai cuisine KARIM's is second to none, it undoubtedly is the uncrowned king to the cuisine with lips smacking abilities. Ever since KARIM's has spread its roots to different number of branches they seen to have cornered the quality and taste is what I hear from fellow foodies and after the experience I somehow agree to their opinion. We ordered a serving of mutton jahangiri and khameeri rotis for main course and mutton seekh kebabs. Mutton seekh were juicy and soft not exactly melt in mouth but a worthwhile experience, dripping with juices and piping hot with chutney and onions is just the right combination to have. Mutton jahangiri too was well prepared with soft...read more
name: Karim's

review: So after having a splendid experience at ASLAM CHICKEN we decided to give this gully of jama masjid another try, this time it was Al- jawahar that is yet another legendary name in mughlai cuisine. It was easy to find a table for four, so with hunger banging right into the head and having failed to grab some kebabs at quereshi ke kebabs we quickly placed the order that included 1/2 Changezi Chicken 1 dal makhni Breads Shami kebabs, mutton seekh and chicken seekh kebabs. To begin with the kebabs didn't arrive the table at all because they apparently were finished every time we ordered a different one. Coming to the main course , sadly the only course that reached the mighty table in...read more
name: Al Jawahar

review:
Pastries are love and love can take you places, located in rajouri garden main market serving decent bakery stuff at reasonable prices.

I have been going to this bakery for years now and have never been disappointed, some recommendations are their truffle and blueberry cheesecake.

P.S. Avoid the pastas, although they do have other decent snacking options.
name: Anjlika

review: Rajinder da dhaba had been on my list for the last 5-6 years as soon as I turned a non vegetarian, as my cousins kept bragging about the spread they served here for years. I had been here once and had just dal roti because of myself being a "shudhh shakahari". So I along with my foodie partner Mayank Arya reached this place on a Sunday evening only to find that they had closed following a quarrel with a bunch of drunk customers. The above incident took my cravings and eagerness to an unbearable height and hence we headed to the place this time also in our company was Shivam Phukela. So we ordered a couple of servings of their ever so soft mutton galauti kebabs with roomali...read more
name: Vip RDX

review: Little chef is a saviour to all the younsters and other foodies who wish to munch on some snacks at pocket friendly prices. They have an elaborate menu with rolls,snacks and main course. I have pretty much had almost everything on their menu in the recent past. My recommendations will be their rolls and tandoori momos. I have had their soups, kaathis, tandoori snacks main course and almost everything. Their main course is below average with butter chicken being sweet, soup had a bit too much of black pepper, chinese super bowl was rice mixed in chilly chicken gravy that seemed somewhat stale. Overall the place might be the jack of all trades but masters only in rolls and tandoori...read more
name: Little Chef

review: Kohli dhaba aka KC da AC Dhaba is located in the dda market of jail road that is surrounded by another dozen full of dhabas serving rolls and kebabs and other non vegetarian gravy delicacies. The place has been around for more than 2 decades as per my knowledge and has become famous for their tawa chicken served alongside roomali roti which is exactly what we ordered. They have a/c seating as well with slightly higher prices and taxes. The tawa chicken was made well in tomato gravy with homely measure of spices that made it taste simple yet delectable. The roomali rotis were hot and surprisingly freshly made. The onion and home style mint chutney were another headsup. Now for the...read more
name: Kohli Dhaba

review:
Chowringhee is not exactly your 34,chowringheee lane outlet that limits itself to just lip smacking rolls.

Located opposite to sri venkateshwara college in south campus, satyaniketan market the place serves almost everything that any other cafe in the vincinity serves and infact even more.

Still the safest bet are the rolls and the tandoori momos by my opinion.

Never had the chance to try their cafe and main course cuisine of any sort and hence will be back ASAP.

P..s They have outdoor seating as well.
name: Chowringhee

review:
Murliwala sweets is like this corner sweet shop with not the greatest of taste and quality but is value for money.

Located on the red light of paschim vihar just before the upmarket part of the punjabi bagh club road begins.

As far as the snacks and breakfast options are concerned they taste decent and are light on the pocket too.

My pick will be their pav bhaji.

The sweets are also worth the mention with the kaju katli outshining the rest with a delectable margin.
name: Murliwala Sweets

review: Old delhi has a lot to offer is probably the most heard line by my set of ears for the last few years. Here on this national platform I announce that the above statement is true to the core. Having heard,read and seen pictures and reviews of people who've been to ASLAM CHICKEN we decided to give this place a visit on 14th of august. Accompanied by Mayank Arya and Shivam Phukela we reached jama masjid area looking for aslam chicken and finally reached the place while giving the other equally tempting eateries a hungry but patient look. So as we found a table for ourselves on the top floor, to our surprise we found read more
name: Aslam Chicken

review:
There are some places that hold a special soft corner in your hearts because of your fond memories especially childhood memories and then there are those that are legendary in the food they serve,this place is a mix of both and hence deserves a thumbs up.

They serve bhalla paapri,golgappas and other chaat stuff that taste more than amazing, they also serve this soya chaap steaks with gravy and rumali rotis that costs ₹70/- which undoubtedly a must try being my favourite.

Do give this place a try, p.s. It's crowded as hell.
name: Raju Chat Bhandar

review:
New durga dosa corner is located right next to dominos in paschim vihar,serving budget friendly South Indian cuisine.

We have dined in and ordered from this place a number of times, and have never been disappointed.

The best bet over here is mixed vegetables utthapam and thr dosas are decent to taste too.

No points for the ignorable ambianca and slow service.

Recommended for a not so light evening snack, avoid going with family.
name: New Durga Corner

review: So these buddies of mine wished to have a scrumptious North Indian non vegetarian meal before "saavan ka mahina" started and it was already 11pm we had no other choice but to reach this market full of non vegetarian budget eateries in jail road. The ambiance is done in a flashy manner with glitter everywhere, and shiny sofas and dim lighting. One thing I like about these places is their no nonsense attitude with the North Indian cuisine. So we ordered 1/2 portion of butter chicken and roti's. Freshly cut masala onions and green mint chutney came up first,there are very few places that satisfy my craving for a nice chutney this was one of those yayy!!! So coming to the food...read more
name: Royal Punjab

review:
So after having had a grand shccess with their outlets in paschim vihar and meera bagh they have now opened up an outlet in this vegetarian's paradise aggarwal plaza in netaji subhash place market.

Now also serving main course apart from amritsari koolcha, the outlet is very small and lacks tables indoor instead you eat sitting outside in the arcade that too in paper dishes.

So I ordered a serving of amritsari koolcha and sad to say the taste has changed, the quality has taken the dip of a diver and is no longer on my favourite breakfast list.

Sad to see a hero fall.
name: Baljeet's Amritsari Koolcha

review: LANTERNS KITCHEN & BAR is this 15 year old gem of a place located in this government building bang opposite rajendra place metro station. So we were here for an INDEPENDENCE DAY brunch. Being a dry day we didn't try any cocktails but they are dirt cheap as shown in the menu. So as you enter the place you see dim lighting and wooden tables placed on barrels that store alcohol. They have a waiter on call system,every waiter wears a watch that rings as you press the button and they reach you at the earliest. Having had a long look around the place and checking out their buffet spread I found no lanterns around that made curious enough to enquire about the same from the owner himself,to...read more
name: Lanterns Kitchen & Bar

review:
Located in GH-7 market of paschim vihar the outlet serves street style snacks mostly chinese.

Famous for their marinaded momos the place was full on a Friday that took them 20 odd minutes to get us a serving chicken marinaded momos and a thumbs up.

Fried chicken dumplings in chilly sauce and mayo topped with oregano tasted just about average by my standards.

A nice try but nothing out of the world, recommended.
name: Sunil Momos.com

review: This is a bakery cum restaurant located in the market of model town 2. We were here for light snacks with family alongside a meeting with some distant relatives. So we ordered soft drinks, fresh lime soda and veg sandwiches (grilled and normal both) spring rolls and tea and coffee. All this for 11 people cost us 1880/- that was quite a decent amount. Now the bad rating Before leaving the waiter demanded a tip (already tipped the change ₹20/-). To which my brother smiling replied that he didn't have change and got a response from him that turned the hell out of me,he actually had the audacity to say "sir wo 100 rupey aur miley hain na?" Places with such wait staff should...read more
name: Grand Plaza

review:
Nagpal choley bhaturey is located in A-1 block of lawrence road serving lip smacking choley bhaturey and choley rice with meethi lassi that can put you to sleep for hours.

So we decided to go here for a Sunday breakfast.

The choley are near perfect tasty chick peas with balanced flavours and oodles of oil with bhaturey coming fresh from the kadhai.

Though they are paneer bhaturey but still are light when compared to most of the other places.

₹60/- for choley bhaturey and ₹40/- for lassi

In total a ₹100/- can put your appetite to test or rather rest.
name: Nagpal's

review:
We ordered some indian main course from this place for a family get together last sunday and were surprised by both the food and the service that turned out to be quite a bommer.

The dal makhni was creamy in texture and was cooked on slow stove I suppose as the lentils were soft enough.

Malai kofta has never been my palate and this was no different so give it a pass will be my take on it.

Paneer shahi korma had crumbled cottage cheese in it and it almost looked like extra gravy with the malai kofta.

The food tasted decent and was delivered on time,what else do you need.

Cheers and keep eating.
name: Amrit Family Rasoi

review:
Located on the punjabi bagh club road right next to manav residency the small kiosk promises to serve mughlai cuisine food with the right flavours and taste but fails miserably to keep its promise.

So we ordered for a party

3 full portions of butter chicken
2 full portions of cream chicken

The order was delayed by an hour as expected so they lose points here as well.


The quality of chicken used was substandard and taste too is not worth much talking about.

Butter chicken was a bit sweet and cream chicken had no cream in it.

Not recommended as it spoiled our evening so you guys beware of their destruction abilities.
name: Dili's Chawla Chik Inn

review: The Hudson Cafè as the name suggests is located in the centre of Hudson lane in GTB nagar almost the centre of the lane. As you take the stairs to the first floor of the place you see bricky interiors on walls with white shining tables and chairs that make the place look a bit chic style upmarket, as you raise your heads up to the ceilings you see mirrors and whole lot of them, I must confess they make the place look completely different. They have a seating capacity of 40 odd people and a mini mocktail bar as well. You might just have to wait to get a table here almost on any day of the week. MOCKTAILS AND SHAKES FERRERO ROCHER SHAKE- You just can't hate anything that associates its...read more
name: The Hudson Cafe

review:
Tucked in the corner of ever bake in shalimar bagh the outlet serves some delicious chaat varieties at reasonable prices.

Ever since the evolution of BTW in rani bagh and nsp almost every tikki wala has made tikki into a chaat by adding anaar, yoghurt and other chaat enhancers.

I simply love the place for my childhood memories attached with it.

Recommended 3/5
name: Mitthu Tikki Wala

review:
Paramjeet machhiwala is this small shop on main najafgarh road outside fun cinemas moti nagar.

Serves fried chicken that is full of calories and taste, probably the best snack with a cold one.

Also had their mutton seekh rolls and fried chicken lollipops that were decent to taste.

There is something in their marination that makes the chicken soft and juicy as hell,you'd love it for sure.

Will be back soon to have some more.
name: Paramjeet Machi Wala

review:
There is nothing so special about mc donalds apart from it being easily available almost every part of the city with standard taste and quality.

So we visited this place when we had gone to try its upmarket sibling WENDY'S, yes you read it right when I asked my buddy why mc donalds the reply was hilarious "Bhai wahan pizza mc puff nhi milta na".

They never disappoint with quality and quick service is their USP, I guess that sums it up to the possible extent.

P.s. It is not so crowded courtesy the leisure valley market full of eateries.
name: McDonald's

review:
Bikanerwala to some is just another casual chaat wala and to some it is a life saver.

So as I completed my meeting we reached wendy's the latest American fast food giant that entered India by opening its flagship outlet in gurgaon.

Me and sissy dear had a good meal experience with their fabulous burgers and fries, but my mum a vegetarian had a different story to tell,she hated their soggy mushroom burger like hell and wanted to have something desi indeed.

She called for a pav bhaji and lassi while we settled for a soft drink each.

It brought smile back to her face,what else do I need to say.

Recommended for maintaining standards with utmost grace.
name: Bikanervala

review: DLF CYBERCITY is like this galaxy with stars shining so bright that you can locate it from a distance. Once you're around, you are bound to have a tough time choosing where to go as the arcade is full of these amazing places that you or me for sure have craved to be at some day. ITALIANO as the name reflects is an italian restaurant on the first floor of cyberhub located next to "not just parantha's". The interiors have been done with brick walls and mighty good slogan tags that impressed a lot. The outdoor seating is impressive with lightning but was unavailable due to bad weather. DRINKS LIIT- The Long Island iced tea was well made and missed no spirits giving us a tipsy...read more
name: Italiano

review: My bar refers to a bar where you can drink and dine at such economic pricing that you feel at home. So this is one is the probably the best branch of my bar keeping in mind the decor,location,food and almost everything is way better than the rest. Being a Sunday evening, we had to wait for about 30 minutes to get a table. So we ordered A classic exotic sheesha 2 pitchers of miller 2 portions of chilly chicken A portion of malai chicken tikka A portion of chicken biryani Extra raita The beer was chilled, what else do you need to say about it. The sheesha was well prepared and the server smilingly changed the coal on request. The chilly chicken tasted good enough to call for a...read more
name: My Bar Headquarters

review: Naturals ice cream is this chain that first began its operations in mumbai and has now opened its doors to the frozen dessert cravers in delhi. So after having heard amazing reviews from friends and family we finally decided to head to their flagship outlet in L block of outer circle of connaught place. The outlet was crowded as hell, as if they were serving ice cream for free but that didn't end our hopes we got into the queue. So after tasting 10 odd flavours we zeroed in on cheeku,mango,litchi and tender coconut. All the flavours were sheer bliss to the tastebuds and icing on the cake being they cost us just ₹60/- each and a waffle cone costing ₹10/- each. The taste is king...read more
name: Naturals Ice Cream

review: Ganesh restaurant or also known as ganesh machhiwala is a household name in the localities of karol bagh and its surrounding areas. Now having opened up their second outlet in central market of B block of paschim vihar. They have a huge variety of dishes ranging from starters to main course. So I ordered 250 gms of boneless fish fry that cost me around ₹370/- including taxes. The fish tasted really nice and was fried in front of me, the onions and chutney were probably the best accompaniments that could be offered with the fish. It took them about 20 odd minutes to get my order packed without any kind of rush so service needs a bit of improvement. I'm heading back really soon. A...read more
name: Ganesh Restaurant

review: ********** Review no 250 ********** Alkakori Alkauser is this place with the status of legendary mughlai and North Indian cuisine. I have literally seen people swear about their kakori kebabs, galouti kebabs and their biryani. Infact there are few mid night delivery chains that I will not name that serve their biryaani at premium prices in the odd hours of the night. So as you reach the place you see cars lined up waiting for their orders to arrive, these cars could range from an ALTO to a BMW 7 SERIES. We got our chicken biryani and mutton galouti kebabs packed. The meal cost us ₹650/- The biryani was well cooked with decent amount of chicken and really nice aroma filled rice. A...read more
name: Alkakori

review:
Sam's bar & restaurant or also commonly known as Sam's cafe is this tiny of a place in paharganj near the crazily filled my bar.

Go here for dirt cheap booze and decent snacks with not so peppy music and a silent environment, you might see a couple of tables occupied by the foreigners.

So we had like 8 odds of blenders pride a glenfiddich and a Long Island for drinks.

For food we ordered chicken tikka, honey chilly potatoes, momos and chilly chicken.

We ended up paying ₹2500 for all this.

The drinks are really affordable and the food is a bit on the sad part with the portion sizes being small.

Recommended for a cheap hangout with friends.
name: Sam's Restaurant & Bar

review:
This particular outlet is located on the main najafgarh road bang opposite the Tilak Nagar Police Station.

Spread across three floors with the ground floor for snacks and sweets and the above two floors for dining.

However I just had the opportunity to try their sweets and snacks.

The chaat items are decent to taste and I can sense some competition for Bikanerwala and Om Sweets that are just a kilometer apart.

You can bank upon them for a decent chaat outing and the sweets as well.
name: Haldiram's

review:
There are some food joints that take up a special place in your heart, this is undoubtedly one of them.

Located near the hanuman mandir for the spiritual people and near DC delhi HQ for the car lovers, the outlet serves street food including rajma rice, choley rice, karhi rice and choley bhaturey.

The outlet is closed only from 1 am to 4 am.

They serve rice with a crispy papad and raw cut onions.

The place is legendary, and so is the food.
