"Ek try toh banta hai boss"
name: Jain Chawal Wale

review: GASTRONOMICA is this newly opened up restaurant in GK-1 M block market that serves multiple cuisines including european,north indian,pan asian and italian amongst others with a twist. As you take the wooden staircase to the second floor of the building and see the ambiance that includes nicely done chairs and tables and also the walls that have nice quotes written on them saying "TRUST ME YOU CAN DANCE- WINE" is one amongst many. The ambiance is focused on wine to a much prominent extent with wine glass rims used to make patterned decor pieces and with cheers written in about 15 languages on another wall. You are bound to feel that the place is a casual hangout but trust me when you...read more
name: Gastronomica Kitchen & Bar

review:
We visited this place a couple of days ago for dinner, already hungry as hell and having heard a lot about the food we quickly ordered:-
Chicken seekh kebabs
Tawa chicken &
Rotis

The seekh kebabs tasted really nice and were made very soft and tasted close to perfection.

The tawa chicken that has been termed as their speciality was nothing short of a disaster as the chicken was uncooked and the gravy was very thick, it tasted so bad that we left it midway and left.

All the points are for the seekh kebabs that were really nice, the rest is better not talked about.Mayank Arya
name: Saleem Mughlai Foods

review: Ever bake is this bakery that has been in this area for long because of the quality that they serve in each and every item they make. I have been coming here since my childhood and had their kaathi sabzi with rumali rpti that tastes very nice. So I along with Akansha Kalra reached this place last Sunday morning in search of nice pasta but to our bad luck it wasn't available. So we went ahead with:- A italian chocolate pastry A chilly paneer hotdog A veggie delight square pizza The hotdog and pizza were prepared and presented in a very nice manner and tasted equally good, however the pastry was the disappointment of the day as it was stale and hard not like it used to be here...read more
name: Ever Bake

review: DAKSHIN is this South Indian cuisine restaurant in Sheraton, that opened up about a decade ago, catering to the authentic taste of South Indian food that is not just limited to your dosa and uthappam etc. I must confess that when it comes to food ITC always puts up a great show with the speciality and detailing on each and every prospect in the place. As you enter the place you are welcomed with nice floral scent and carnatic music playing in the background. The interiors are very upmarketly indian and give you somehow a feel of a temple, as they are sober looking yet charming. The dining area is not very big but very well accommodated. We were for the KARAVALI FEST going on from...read more
name: Dakshin - Sheraton New Delhi Hotel

review: My review somehow got deleted and I don't have a backup. So this place happened to me by the recommendations of fellow buddy Sandy, causing me to raise my expectations to certain level that they could not live up to. First of all the location of the outlet is not tilak nagar it rather is Subhash Nagar near Cambridge foundation school. So I got the food packed that included Keema kaleji (veg) Soya kfc Soya orly And bunty bubbly rolls The names given to the dishes are somehow very tempting that again raised my expectations. Talking about the food KEEMA KALEJI- This is a maincourse dish that is basically soya granules in some kind of masala that looked and tasted somehow like bhaji...read more
name: Sardarji Malai Chaap Wale

review:
This shop is located in middle of the arya samaj road that stays crowded as hell on all days of the week.

Parking can be a tricky thing when in this vincinity.

Talking about the food served, the place is a bakery serving decent snack options and bread.

My story with polka goes back to about ten years, this is the first place I had a footlong (hotdog shaped pizza).

The cakes here are also nice, giving shah bakery a run for their money.

Recommended but I've heard that they've lost their charm.
name: Polka

review:
Located near fun cinemas moti nagar,
The place serves lip smacking choley bhaturey and amritsari lassi to die for.

The place is very close to my mamu's place and we've been patrons of their choley bhaturey for years as it used to be a fixed Sunday breakfast for us .


Even now whenever I'm free I try to go grab a bite reliving those memories again.

By far the best choley bhaturey in this part of the city.
name: C L Corner

review:
Grover sweets is this old, really very old sweet shop in the moti nagar area right next to fun cinemas.


I have my mamu's place close by so we've been having snacks and sweets from this place for quite some time know.

Right from the rice dhokla to the khandvi and samosas etc to their mouthwatering sweets, the place is a total bliss.

Also not to forget the gulab jamun and the kulfi falooda, you really can't go wrong on this place.

Clearly the best sweet shop in the area.
name: Grover Sweet

review:
NATRAJ DAHI BHALLE WALA is this small yet famous chaat corner serving dahi bhalle and desi ghee aloo tikki for decades.

located in between the route of chandni chowk metro station and the main market the place is a hype,it's just that the lane is so busy that you see the place full all the time.

i have seen people literally swearing about their dahi bhalle but, sadly i found them quite average in taste over powered by the mint and tamarind chutney.

however I would rather suggest everyone to rather try their desi ghee aloo tikki which if not great but is somehow better than their overhyped dahi bhalle.

will I go there again?
not really.
name: Natraj Dahi Bhalle Wala

review: SAKLEY'S THE MOUNTAIN CAFE is this romantic dim lit themed cafe located in M block GK-1 market that has off late become the new food hub in the city. The interiors are nice filled with nice black and white pictures with very dim lighting that gives it the romantic look. Me and my friend were here for lunch, so we ordered :- BEVERAGES HOKEY POKEY- Their take on the LIIT without coke, a brave move and I must confess a successful one. SECRET GARDEN- A vodka based drink with orange zest and kiwi, highly recommended to say the least. VIRGIN MOJITO- Mojito was well made with the zest of lime and mint, non alcoholics that's the one for you. FOOD FRESHLY MADE CHICKEN NACHOS WITH...read more
name: Music & Mountains - Hillside Cafe

review:
This is a tiny little kiosk serving biryani and korma curries by weight, located bang opposite manjeet chicken corner.

We were two hungry monks ready to horge on to some amazingly flavourful biryani served with sides of chatni, mirchi ka saalan and korma gravy.

The biryani to my surprise was mildly spiced with just the right blend of flavours and ample pieces of well done chicken on the bone, a must try for all who like biryani.

The sides were nice too, in fact I would like to have the korma next time around keeping in mind the taste of the gravy.

A small little advice would be to improve hygiene standards and get a a/c installed for the convenience of the customers.
name: Muradabadi Shahi Biryani & Chicken Corner

review: Saravana bhavan is like the pilgrimage to South Indian food lovers like my mommy dear who can have dosa's all her life and never complain. So as we took the delivery of my new car (happy to announce, not bragging), and thought of eating something nice we zeroed in on this place. We reached here at around five o'clock we were amazed to see that it was full on the basement floor,but we got a table easily. We ordered Onion Rava masala dosa that really tasted nice with sambhar different from other South Indian places to eat. Ghee roast masala dosa was another dish that we had and the size of this particular dosa was way too big for one person. The mix uthppam and sambhar idli also...read more
name: Saravana Bhavan

review: So finally I visited the much talked about outlet of art of spices (parent branch to paschim vihar one that I've been before, yet to be reviewed) in karol bagh to dig into their famous chicken roll that I had been craving for so long. So we zeroed in kn the basic chicken rolls without egg, this roll costs only rupees 50/- per piece and tastes good. The stuffing is nice and more than just ample in fact it's amazing, but the stuffing is very dry honestly I'm yet to find a roll with chicken is not that dry. The parantha was dripping in oil and hence complimented the stuffing well. Will I go there again? Maybe the paschim vihar branch because it's nearby.read more
name: Art of Spices

review: This outlet is located bang opposite metro station of janpath next to shiv sagar restaurant. We were supposed to meet at sarvana bhavan that was already full, so we ended up eating here. The service is nice and quick, food is standard and same in taste with barely any deviations. We had the Mc chicken burger with meal and the pancakes that tasted yum. Strange when you get breakfast and normal menu both at the same time, yes we entered at 10:55 am. Nice enough to grab a bite.Sinchita Kar (The BienVita) Christina Peter Sadish Gargread more
name: McDonald's

review:
This is another vegetarian food joint in the aggarwal plaza in NSP serving decent Chinese & North Indian cuisine snacks.

Visited them last night and ordered half portion of achaari chaap tikka.

The chaap tikka was decent to taste and spicy enough to be given the tag of achaari, recommended by fellow foodie friends Sadish Garg & Sandy had to give it a try and I must say I'm coming back soon.
name: SGF - Spice Grill Flame

review:
Mc donalds is not a fast food chain it's a life saver for people starving and running out of time who can grab a bite on the go.

Mc donalds has always maintained taste and quality at all the outlets kudos to them for such a commendable job.

I have been going here since I was a little kid and wanted a happy meal every weekend, now times have changed but my craze for visiting this outlet has not.

They are one of the only ones around in my area serving the breakfast menu, so whenever I want to have some pancakes.
name: McDonald's

review:
Sighri is this small little kiosk in Janak puri, being the parent outlet of the chain with 3 outlets now it is the most famous and crowded one as well.

The place is mostly crowded during the evening time as it caters to both home delivery and car service as well.


Famous for it's tandoori momos, i would suggest you to stick to the chinese stuff only apart from the tandoori momos, and the curries and north indian food better be given a pass.

Suggessions:-
TANDOORI MOMOS
SPRING ROLLS
LEMON CHICKEN GRAVY.
name: Sighri

review:
I had previously reviewed this place but somehow I can't see it here, so here I go again.

Located in subhash nagar dda market the place is known to serve curries and kebabs with a punjabi twist.

Their kaali mirch cream chicken is beyond words,simply the best you could to chicken, cream and kalimirch.

The chicken afghani is also really good.

One of the best North Indian restaurants in the vinsinity.
name: Sethi's Restaurant & Barbeque

review:
Kulfiano is this small kiosk in the jail road DDA market that serves about 25-30 flavours of kulfi at affordable prices.

Having been a success at HKV and SAKET outlets they opened here.

We had the anaar kulfi and the paan kulfi, the paan kulfi was decent enough to finish but nothing exceptional, however the anaar kulfi was like anaardana I literally had to throw it in the bin.

Conclusion: you could do without having this ever in your life.
name: Kulfiano

review:
Billi's hut is a small little kiosk at the back end of the netaji subhash market food court.

Serving fast food and north indian or shall I say serving fast food with a North Indian touch is actually what they do.

Having heard a lot about this place from many people lead me to this place.


We ordered a white sauce cheese pasta that arrived in minutes , however it tasted okayish not so good not so bad .

Simply put the place is very much overhyped it would rather be a place where the nearby office going people would meet over a meal or snacks.
With Sadish Garg
name: Billu's Hut

review: IMPROMPTU is this gem of a place located in VATIKA TOWERS, GURGAON on the ground floor. The interiors are beautifully done with hexagonal shape being the common link right from the building to the bulb hangings, though I was there for lunch I could imagine how beautiful the place would look once the switched the lights on in the evening. The place has an open sitting as well to enjoy your food with friends in case the sun quits showing how hot it is. As we were welcomed inside with a pretty smile on the server's faces the experience began with a kickstart to the heat with coolers & mocktails. First came the cold coffee and the mango mint thandai, the cold coffee was nice as always...read more
name: Impromptu

review: Located in rajouri garden market back side the outlet or rather all these outlets cater to night owls like myself and some od you as well. Gone are the days where we had to look for places to have food good enough to satisfy your hunger at odd hours. Most of the food items here are microwaveable that satisfy your hunger upto a certain level but you can't expect the food to be lipsmacking and in ample quantity. I had the changezi chicken with khameri roti combo that cost me 285 bucks, same amount spent at changezi chicken outlet in tagore garden during the day time would give you quarter chicken and roti's whereas all this combo did to my hunger was to take it to another level. Combo...read more
name: 24Seven

review: ********** REVIEW NO 200 ********** It all started with love for food and now almost a year and a half later I've reached my 200 th review. ZOMATO has helped me a lot right from starting as a restaurant guide to giving me a platform to express my thoughts and views on food to other users so that they have a wonderful time eating out. Alright back to the review now, Located in the heart of NSP market the outlet attracts a huge crowd of burger lovers. I have already been to the saket and cp outlets of Burger King and had mediocre experiences , sad to announce this one was no different. The whooper burger is a bulkier version of the MC chicken burger at MC donalds , also had the mango...read more
name: Burger King

review:
Located near the choti subzi mandi the place serves standard republic of chicken stuff .

mostly microwaveable stuff and ofcourse the famous for nothin roasted chicken.


Food is okayish to taste but afterall it's heat'n'eat stuff so you can grab a bite but can't rely on them for a meal.
name: Republic of Chicken

review:
Chaap chobara is a small shop in subhash nagar near the market where seth's restaurant and barbecue is.

I have never visited this place but have seen it while passing from nearby, so we got chaap starters of three kinds from this place for a house party.

The golden fried chaap or the kfc chaap was simply fab, though I can no more see it on the menu but it was the best chaap dish that I've ever tasted in my life.

Will be back whenever I'm nearby next time.
name: Chaap Chhobara

review:
Roshan di kulfi is one of those places that are known to serve lipsmacking street food and kulfi for decades.

Located in main karol bagh market the place is undoubtedly the most crowded eatery in the market.

I have almost had everything on their menu but sadly don't have any pictures to attach with.

Kulfi and tikki are the best bets around the area .

But it gives me intense grief writing that i feel that they have lost their charm over the past few years, I just so hope they pull their socks and turn best in business yet again serving our favourite chaat items and kulfi.
name: Roshan Di Kulfi

review:
This particular outlet of giani's is my favourite one, because of it's location on the road and because I had my favourite banana split sundae for the very first time.

Located in vishal enclave it is surrounded by cafe's and other small time eateries on main najafgarh road.

The best items on their menu are:-
Banana split sundae
Hot chocolate fudge
American waffle (rarely available)

Visit Recommended !!!
name: Giani's

review:
The cake point located in Punjabi bagh club road has been here for quite some time now.

Serving cakes and bakes of decent quality and great taste being their USP.

We get our cakes and bakery stuff from the place every time we're around.

A visit is recommended.
name: The Cake Point

review: BIG YELLOW DOOR is the latest and ongoing sensation for the DELHI UNIVERSITY students when it comes to food . Located in the SATYANIKETAN market right opposite SRI VENKATESWARA COLLEGE the place is more than just a crowd puller. Four of us reached here around 1 pm and asked for a table, we had a waiting for 35 minutes, but for the most happening place in the city itna toh banta hai. As we entered the place i see it's a very small place full of people, so the wait is not because of so many people wanting to be here it's rather because of less space. So we were seated to a table or rather on the floor, and mind you i hated that. So we made the order that was:- 1. A Nachos baked dish 2....read more
name: Big Yellow Door

review:
Apna dhaba is the sibling of YOURS CHOLEY BHATUREY, situated in vikas puri.

Their dal makhni and kadhai paneer with lachha parantha is usually what we order for.

Food is tasty , hardly any seating space but delivery or take away is what I would recommend.

P.s. It could get a little too tricky on weekends with people waiting for hours to get their food packed.
name: Apna Dhaba Old

review:
Located in hari nagar the outlet is standard green chick stuff woth a couple of tables put outside to enjoy your heat'n'eat snacks.


I just love their sandwich and cocktail salami like hell.

The ready to eat snacks are decent enough to try.
name: Green Chick Chop

review:
Though it's called a 24/7 outlet but they are yet to do so after being opened for about a year and a half.

But yes the combos that they serve can be termed as expensive but they are in true sense life savers for night owls like most people of our generation.

Their hotdogs are just a hype so avoid.


But do try their changezi combos from the house of changezi chicken.
name: 24Seven

review:
The cafe is a small kiosk in vikas puri serving decent South Indian street food quality stuff.

Delivery is not recommended, instead go for a dine in , and do try the mix uthappam and the fresh and tasty idli's.

The sambhar is surprisingly tasty, though I don't really like sambhar of most places.
name: New Madras Cafe

review:
Located near the 20 block gurudwara , the place is an average sweet shop serving sweets and snacks.

Their dhokla and khandvi are fresh and tasty, but the samosas are pathetic.


Visit recommended only when you are nearby and want to have a nice little gujrati snack.
name: Bikaner Sweets & Pastry Corner

review:
Another outlet of the much famous sethi restaurant in rajouri garden.

The decor and seating at the place is below standard , but it's the food that completely stands out.

Right from the tandoori snacks like peshawari tikka and afghani chicken and their fried chicken to the main course in non vegetarian like karahi chicken and butter chicken.

The place is a must visit for taste not on the decor and ambiance.

Special mention for Rahul Gambhir's favourite KAALI MIRCHI CREAM CHICKEN.
name: Sethi Restaurant

review:
Located opposite GANDHI CYCLES in the main market of tilak nagar, serving nice and decent bakery stuff like pastries, cakes and snacks like patties, paneer kulcha etc that taste nice and better than the rest of the bakery's in the area.


Some favourite items of mine served over here are:-
The truffle pastry
Paneer kulcha
And mini pizza.
name: Manmohan Bakery

review:
Located near the reliance fresh outlet in tilak nagar, the place serves decent cold cuts and ready to eat snacks as well as heat and eat microwave stuff.

The service is quick and the food is tasty and economical.

Some items to try out are
Chicken 65
Chicken sandwich
And chicken cocktail salami.
name: Green Chick Chop

review:
Located near Arya samaj road the bakery serves standard below average bakery and confectionery stuff.

Though it is by far the best bakery in uttam nagar but still needs a lot of improvement, regarding the staff, quality and hygiene standards.

However with no options left , their patties both veg and paneer are the safest bet, however cakes and pastries are not reccomended at all.
name: Shah Bakery

review:
This place serves sweets and namkeens along with the standard chaat stuff.

The ambiance and decor are okayish because of them being a sweet shop and not catering to fine dine.

Some of the items to look out for are:-
Pyaaz ki kachori
Dahi bhalla paapri
And their gol gappe

To the best of my knowledge , they were the ones to bring the concept of fountain gol gappa serving style using the vending machines.

Their kaaju katli is one of the best I have had.

Highly recommended.
name: Gulab

review: This outlet is located in the very beginning of the GK-1 M block market. Located on the first floor, you first take the staircase to the outlet. It is quite a big place with capacity of seating about 50 odd people. We entered at about 5 pm and it was full already so we had to wait for about 20 minutes to get our table. The order takers are rude, taking orders of maybe regular people first irrespective of the queue. Anyways we ordered a humis and pita platter and cherry chocolate cake . The food was bad actually very bad, stale and hard from the outside that we had to leave midway of the experience after having waited for 20 minutes. Not reccomended at all.read more
name: Starbucks Coffee

review:
Well even I'm gonna add another feather to the hat full of bad reviews and remarks for this place.

Located in ashok nagar the bakery serves standard baked stuff like cakes, pastries and snacks.

They serve quite a lot of variety but sadly the same cannot be said about the taste and quality.

None of the food served here stands out.

Not reccomended at all.
name: Sethi's The Cake Shop

review: Wildfire is a brazilian cuisine based barbeque restaurant in the CROWNe PLAZA hotel in Gurgaon sector 29. The entry to the hotel is grand and welcoming. As soon as we entered the place, we were greeted with a pleasant smile and guided towards our reserved table. DECOR The decor is simply fantabulous, you fall in love with it as soon as you enter the place, you see dim lighting with small lamps and table lights. STAFF The staff is very welcoming and helpful, they keep telling about each and every dish they in detail about the the ingredients and the process of cooking, also they kept asking for repeats. BEVRAGES We had the fruit juice sangria and the beer sangria, both equally...read more
name: Wildfire - Crowne Plaza

review:
Located in the market of sector 10 dwarka, the place is a franchise/ outlet of the famed apni rasoi paschim puri.

Serving vegetarian North Indian cuisine and thali's the place is a take away joint with few tables outside, also catering to home delivery.


Daal makhni and karahi paneer are the ones to go for here, however you could also have the malai kofta.

All i can say in a nutshell is that the place used to be much much better than this, the quality and taste have deteriorated over the few years.
name: Apni Rasoi

review:
Well the place is simple no brag no swag , just simple sweets and other standard halwai stuff.
Located in the dwarka sector 6 market it is one of the best breakfast places in the market.

Some items to look out for
Choley bhaturey
Chowmein
And crispy pakoras and samosas .

The sweets also look tempting, never had them though.

They have a branch in mayapuri as well.
name: New Raja Sweets

review: This place is located in mayapuri main road, another branch of khalsa chain serving North Indian and punjabi and chinese mix cuisine. The service is a bit too slow for anyone's liking , it takes them 20 minutes to serve water. Reservations are not done here, so expect a 30 odd minutes waiting for weekends and holidays. The decor is kinda jugaad type, portions are good enough. The food Butter chicken is nice and creamy tomato gravy with boiled chicken a 2.5/5 The fried chicken is literally the star here , it was fabulously made and crispy with no extra oil a 4/5. In a nutshell you could visit them after drinks or with friends not for a family gathering though. Food-...read more
name: New Khalsa Restaurant

review: Located near the 20 block gurudwara connected to new krishna park is this famous and crowded non vegetarian restaurant serving north indian and punjabi fusioned chinese cuisine. The ambiance and decor is not much to talk about as it is just normal chairs and tables. The food I will only comment on the North Indian spread as that's all I've had over here. We had the daal makhni , butter chicken and butter naan. The daal was nice in taste and texture was also okaayish, it lacked creaminess though. The butter chicken was standard sweet tomato gravy with a bit of chilly and pieces of chicken. The butter naan was loaded with a lot of butter and wasn't chewy as well. Overall an average...read more
name: Khalsa Tandoor

review: This is a momos joint located on the back side of the DDA market I have been here before as well The chicken momos are fine But we had a horrible experience We ordered a portion of chicken steamed momos - arrived quickly and were okayish to taste. So we ordered a plate of fried chicken momos- as soon as they arrived we were in shocked, the steamed momos and fried momos were both in different sizes and shapes. As we take the first bite , the disaster is no longer just the presentation it's the taste as well , all most burnt momos with outer covering as thick as a samosa dipped in oil like hell. So we called the waiter and asked for a replacement, who arrogantly pointed us towards the...read more
name: Momos Corner

review: Chicken changezi is one dish out of many that almost every DELHITE would be proud of. The outlet I'm writing about is located in Tagore Garden after the Delhi famous BAND BAAJA MARKET. Parking is not a problem over here at the place, the place is divided into two equal parts one for the kitchen and the other for dining. The ambiance is not really much to talk about, normal below average seating and cutlery, but the walls are something to talk about basically a bit of sketching of "purani dilli" giving you a kind of feel of the real purani dilli. THE FOOD We ordered qtr. chicken changezi ,1 daal makhni and khameeri and tandoori roti's. The service was prompt Food was close...read more
name: Changezi Chicken

review:
Located near KFC in CP
The outlet promises to serve authentic maarvari and gujrati cuisine, but to me it fails to keep the promise.
As you enter you are greeted and guided to your table
The table wasn't clean , they cleaned it after we were seated
The food served had a lot of variety but lacked taste and authenticity
I mean are you served daal makhni and mattar paneer in maarvaadi bhoj or gujrati bhoj , no .
The variety helps but it doesn't cover up the lack of both taste and hygiene.
The waiters literally clap to call each other.

Wonder how they get such good reviews from celebrities

reccomendations well not really anything was there to amaze me.


Would i go back again NEVER EVER
name: Rajdhani

review:
A tiny little outlet of subway walking distance from my college, can it be any better no it can't be.

Located near the C-2. Bus stop this outlet is already buzzing around my college buddy's so gave it a try today.

The decor is better than other outlets of subway the walls have a drawing kind of thing on them that impresses me a lot.

The staff is nice and well mannered , they got my meal done in 3-5 minutes.


Ordered my favourite SUBWAY CLUB with double meat
The bread and veggies were fress and so was the meat , what else do you need it's good to go
Kudos to the team
Best of luck !!!
name: Subway

review:
This outlet is located near the tilak nagar metro station the handi restaurant building
Normal mc donalds stuff
The food is standard
Service is quick
Not tried home delivery though
A meal at mc donalds never disappoints I guess

review:
After having read a review by fellow foodie mr.Vivek I was tempted to try this place someday,and today happened to be that day.

Located on main najafgarh road near Kirti nagar they serve dahi bhalla and papri bhalla.

The bhalle were soft and the paapri was full of crunch spiced to perfection the taste was good a new favourite it might just be for me atleast.

Priced at rs. 80 per plate I must say the portion size is too big it filled my empty stomach to the most
I'll be back again soon.
name: Jeet Chaat Bhandar

review: This cafe is located in the RAJIV GANDHI RENEWABLE ENERGY PARK opposite KINGDOM OF DREAMS covered with greenery on both sides the place can easily be missed. The cafe is run by solar and other sources of energy that is generated by swings used by kids, a new concept i must say. The cafe is filled with people enjoying their cup of coffee and relaxing in such a good atmosphere. The interiors are good Murrahs and chairs look nice with the tables We were a group of 8-9 people, having done with our lunch came here to have a nice cup of tea or coffee. The food and beverages We had the masale chai and french press coffee which were both decent in taste The french press coffee is their...read more

DABELI, VADA PAAV AND SOYA KULCHA
these have always been a delight to me
Spicy, sweet
Hope to get to se many such more outlets in the city

name: QD's Restaurant

review: Located in the satya niketan market corner the place serves some cool shakes and sundae's based on ice cream and kassata The name is famous for their shakes all over the city. Maybe notRahul Gambhir Sameep James Alibharead more

review: This is the new kid on the block near south campus or satya niketan market The interiors are amazing quite up to my taste with a wish wall and nice quotes all over the walls. name: Amigo's Hub

review: This pizza joint is located near the janakpuri superspeciality hospital Being a new establishment they have introduced promotional scheme booklet with various offers including the buy 2 get 1 free offer on buffet dinner Okay so this is how it works You get unlimited Veg/non veg soup Garlic and cheese toasties 20 types of salads 4 slices of classic and 4 slices of your choice out of the classics And in limited quantity Soft drink & Dessert The decor is done well gives you a nice feel if not as great as posh places. name: Da' Pizza Planet

review: A nice buffet spread for brunch on a nice Saturday afternoon could act as an awesome tonic for a tiring week full of work and tension coming ahead. As we entered we were welcomed with a pleasant smile and nice gesture and were guided towards our reserved table. Ambiance of the place is amazing that's how it should be. The servers were well behaved and courtious. The food The theme for the day was malaysian food. The starters were good to taste and enjoyed by all. The highlight being the salmon The maincourse was nice specially the malaysian was nice the coconut milk curry (veg) was amazing The rest were good too The salmon gravy was also tasty The presentation of food was good...read more

review:

Chicken seekh

180 degrees ice cream and chicken strips
Worth a try if u live far away
Good snacking or meal option for people living or working nearby
name: Burger King

Anyways coming back soon

Located in palam the place serves rolls ,momos and soups of average quality

name: Dada's Rolls & Momos

review:
A 3 is a way too good rating for a good roadside dhaba that lacks basic amenities

Raita - normal 2/5
Must try
Spot on service

Speedy working

Hot chocolate fudge

review:

Om

Dominos

Njoy ur meal????

A friend happened to take me here for a treat and we were told about the on going EUROPEAN FOOD FESTIVAL with the staff dressed as pirates with funky clothing and wigs.

The food mostly impress in all the sections right from the starters to the main course and then the happy part the desserts.

name: Barbeque Nation

review:
This place goes pretty much right with that saying of "oonche naam feekey pakwan"

name: Monga Sweets

Also the aloo tikki bhalla papri and pav bhaji are great in taste and not to forget their trend setting bharwa golgappas which are now called gupchup chat by the copy cats....

Oh wow what a place to be incase wanna a grab a meal

sheesha mocktails grilled sandwich are great

name: De' Bistro
